description: Trail along rocky shore to a cliff face or rocky beach. Steep at times but hike-able by most.Popular all year but directly on the open ocean so dress appropriately. Can be a bit muddy at time but trail is well established. Lots of deer, foxes, sea birds and occasional whale, dolphin or seals. Popular for fishing mackerel from the shore when in season.
directions: From Halifax Armdale rotary, out St. Margaret's Bay Road, left (west) on Highway 333 (Peggy`s Cove Road), after approximately 20 km turn left onto Prospect Bay Road. Drive about 5km and turn right onto Selig`s Road then in 500m left onto Jamil's Road. Follow the turns to end of road and park in cul de sac (1-2 km). Trail head is next to power pole. Shown on google maps as High Head Trail. Known to locals as Wagner's Cove or The Barrens. Follow along shoreline to Indian Point Road in Prospect Village for full length of trail, about 7km one way.
title: Wagner`s Cove
